20110103020112.000|20110103020115.000|TR0|GUPTA:  This is Mossville, Louisiana.  For 
20110103020115.000|20110103020117.000|TR0|decades, residents in this community have 
20110103020117.000|20110103020120.000|TR0|been trying to sound the alarm.  But what 
20110103020120.000|20110103020122.000|TR0|they say is an environmental crime 
20110103020122.000|20110103020125.000|TR0|happening here.  Chemicals in the air, the 
20110103020125.000|20110103020127.000|TR0|ground, the water, making people sick, 
20110103020127.000|20110103020130.000|TR0|killing them off one by one. And for 
20110103020130.000|20110103020133.000|TR0|years, they say those complaints have been 
20110103020133.000|20110103020135.000|TR0|falling on deaf ears.  But what happen to 
20110103020135.000|20110103020138.000|TR0|the people here could happen to any of us.

20110103020835.000|20110103020838.000|TR0|of towners fishing in the bayou, but there 
20110103020838.000|20110103020840.000|TR0|was a problem, the fish started dying.  
20110103020840.000|20110103020843.000|TR0|And then something Harold Arena could not 
20110103020843.000|20110103020845.000|TR0|have predicted, his own family started

20110103020850.000|20110103020853.000|TR0|ARENA:  I had cancer, then my

20110103020903.000|20110103020905.000|TR0|family, or that we knew we ever had 
20110103020905.000|20110103020908.000|TR0|cancer.     GUPTA:  So you had eight 
20110103020908.000|20110103020910.000|TR0|people out of ten get cancer?
20110103020910.000|20110103020913.000|TR0|
20110103020913.000|20110103020915.000|TR0|ARENA:  Right here on 40 acres.
20110103020915.000|20110103020918.000|TR0|
20110103020918.000|20110103020921.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Bone cancer, prostate cancer, 
20110103020921.000|20110103020923.000|TR0|breast cancer, bladder cancer.  I can tell 
20110103020923.000|20110103020926.000|TR0|you as a doctor, the chances of that 
20110103020926.000|20110103020928.000|TR0|happening are incredibly rare.
20110103020928.000|20110103020931.000|TR0|
20110103020931.000|20110103020933.000|TR0|DIANE PRINCE, MOSSVILLE RESIDENT:  I am 
20110103020933.000|20110103020936.000|TR0|very angry.  I am very angry that these 
20110103020936.000|20110103020938.000|TR0|plants will have taken -- have taken -- 
20110103020938.000|20110103020941.000|TR0|have taken a lot of energy, my life, 
20110103020941.000|20110103020943.000|TR0|future life away from me.  Once you have 
20110103020943.000|20110103020946.000|TR0|cancer, you have to understand this, once 
20110103020946.000|20110103020948.000|TR0|you have cancer -- I'm in remission now, 
20110103020948.000|20110103020951.000|TR0|once you have cancer, you live with the 
20110103020951.000|20110103020953.000|TR0|fear because this cancer can come back at 
20110103020953.000|20110103020956.000|TR0|any time.  And when it -- most of the 
20110103020956.000|20110103020958.000|TR0|time, when it comes back a second time, 
20110103020958.000|20110103021001.000|TR0|it's worse.
20110103021001.000|20110103021004.000|TR0|
20110103021004.000|20110103021006.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Diane Prince was diagnosed with 
20110103021006.000|20110103021009.000|TR0|ovarian cancer six years after she and her 
20110103021009.000|20110103021011.000|TR0|husband, David, moved the family across 
20110103021011.000|20110103021014.000|TR0|the street from a vinyl chloride plant in 
20110103021014.000|20110103021016.000|TR0|Mossville.  She wasn't the only family 
20110103021016.000|20110103021019.000|TR0|member who got sick after moving there.
20110103021019.000|20110103021021.000|TR0|
20110103021021.000|20110103021024.000|TR0|DAVID PRINCE, MOSSVILLE RESIDENT:  My 
20110103021024.000|20110103021026.000|TR0|daughter about 14, 15 years old was 
20110103021026.000|20110103021029.000|TR0|diagnosed with endometriosis.  My youngest 
20110103021029.000|20110103021031.000|TR0|son experiences extreme headaches, and my 
20110103021031.000|20110103021034.000|TR0|youngest daughter had extreme sinus 
20110103021034.000|20110103021036.000|TR0|problems.

20110103021052.000|20110103021054.000|TR0|plant.  It drove you crazy.
20110103021054.000|20110103021057.000|TR0|

20110103021059.000|20110103021102.000|TR0|
20110103021102.000|20110103021104.000|TR0|DAVID PRINCE:  They would say, yes, we had 
20110103021104.000|20110103021107.000|TR0|a small release, but it didn't cross the 
20110103021107.000|20110103021109.000|TR0|fence line.  What kind of barrier is that? 
20110103021109.000|20110103021112.000|TR0| It must be recent to the (INAUDIBLE)
20110103021112.000|20110103021114.000|TR0|
20110103021114.000|20110103021117.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Didn't cross the fence line.  How 
20110103021117.000|20110103021119.000|TR0|could they possibly measure that?
20110103021119.000|20110103021122.000|TR0|
20110103021122.000|20110103021124.000|TR0|DEROUSSEL:  What happens is when there is 
20110103021124.000|20110103021127.000|TR0|an incident that occurs, the plants have 
20110103021127.000|20110103021130.000|TR0|personnel that they send out with 
20110103021130.000|20110103021132.000|TR0|monitors, at different places within the 
20110103021132.000|20110103021135.000|TR0|plant and within the community and some on 
20110103021135.000|20110103021137.000|TR0|the fence line to make a determination as 
20110103021137.000|20110103021140.000|TR0|to just how far the effect, if any, has 
20110103021140.000|20110103021142.000|TR0|gone.  And there are minor incidences 
20110103021142.000|20110103021145.000|TR0|where it doesn't reach the fence line.
20110103021145.000|20110103021147.000|TR0|
20110103021147.000|20110103021150.000|TR0|DAVID PRINCE:  It came over, the plant 
20110103021150.000|20110103021152.000|TR0|came over with their little monitoring 
20110103021152.000|20110103021155.000|TR0|equipment in our home and said, oh, 
20110103021155.000|20110103021157.000|TR0|nothing is wrong.  We don't smell 
20110103021157.000|20110103021200.000|TR0|anything.  And that was not true.  That 
20110103021200.000|20110103021202.000|TR0|wasn't true at all.  The whole family 
20110103021202.000|20110103021205.000|TR0|could smell it, the community, my 
20110103021205.000|20110103021207.000|TR0|neighbors could smell it but they couldn't 
20110103021207.000|20110103021210.000|TR0|smell it.
20110103021210.000|20110103021213.000|TR0|
20110103021213.000|20110103021215.000|TR0|GUPTA:  The Princes and their neighbors 
20110103021215.000|20110103021218.000|TR0|would learn about a secret, something 
20110103021218.000|20110103021220.000|TR0|happening right under their feet.  But 
20110103021220.000|20110103021223.000|TR0|first, I wanted to know more.  There's 
20110103021223.000|20110103021225.000|TR0|only so much you can see from the ground.
20110103021225.000|20110103021228.000|TR0|
20110103021228.000|20110103021230.000|TR0|Take a look down here.  What you're 
20110103021230.000|20110103021233.000|TR0|looking at used to be the center of a 
20110103021233.000|20110103021235.000|TR0|rural community.  There are now 14 
20110103021235.000|20110103021238.000|TR0|chemical plants down there.  Many of these 
20110103021238.000|20110103021240.000|TR0|chemical plants came here because of the 
20110103021240.000|20110103021243.000|TR0|promise of no property taxes by the state. 
20110103021243.000|20110103021245.000|TR0| They have coal fire energy plants, petro 
20110103021245.000|20110103021248.000|TR0|chemical plants, chemical plants, many of 
20110103021248.000|20110103021250.000|TR0|them making the raw materials for plastics.
20110103021250.000|20110103021253.000|TR0|
20110103021253.000|20110103021256.000|TR0|In order to understand Mossville, you have 
20110103021256.000|20110103021258.000|TR0|to understand plastic. The first plastics 
20110103021258.000|20110103021301.000|TR0|plants arrived right after World War II, 
20110103021301.000|20110103021303.000|TR0|part of a nationwide boom.  The future was 
20110103021303.000|20110103021306.000|TR0|plastic.  "The Graduate" in 1968 captured 
20110103021306.000|20110103021308.000|TR0|the move.
20110103021308.000|20110103021311.000|TR0|
20110103021311.000|20110103021313.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  I just want to say one 
20110103021313.000|20110103021316.000|TR0|word to you, just one word.

20110103021331.000|20110103021333.000|TR0|
20110103021333.000|20110103021336.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  Plastics.
20110103021336.000|20110103021339.000|TR0|
20110103021339.000|20110103021341.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  Plastic is anything 
20110103021341.000|20110103021344.000|TR0|we ask it to be.
20110103021344.000|20110103021346.000|TR0|
20110103021346.000|20110103021349.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Plastic has changed our lives.  
20110103021349.000|20110103021351.000|TR0|The most common, polyvinyl chloride, PVC.  
20110103021351.000|20110103021354.000|TR0|It's everywhere -- in pipes, vinyl siding, 
20110103021354.000|20110103021356.000|TR0|windows, and other building materials.  
20110103021356.000|20110103021359.000|TR0|It's in cars, in shower curtain, phones, 
20110103021359.000|20110103021401.000|TR0|flooring, storage containers, lunchboxes 
20110103021401.000|20110103021404.000|TR0|and toy; in hospitals, IV bags, in tubing.
20110103021404.000|20110103021406.000|TR0|
20110103021406.000|20110103021409.000|TR0|Most importantly, perhaps, they're also in 
20110103021409.000|20110103021411.000|TR0|our home, just about everywhere you look, 
20110103021411.000|20110103021414.000|TR0|laptop computer for example, that has PVC 
20110103021414.000|20110103021416.000|TR0|in it. Even a simple bucket like this, 
20110103021416.000|20110103021419.000|TR0|flip it over.  You see the number 3, that 
20110103021419.000|20110103021422.000|TR0|means PVC.  Children's toys.  One clue, if 
20110103021422.000|20110103021424.000|TR0|they're softer and more malleable, that's 
20110103021424.000|20110103021427.000|TR0|a clue that PVC is in it.  Speaking of 
20110103021427.000|20110103021429.000|TR0|kids incidentally.  What about school 
20110103021429.000|20110103021432.000|TR0|supplies?  Pencils and pens, they often 
20110103021432.000|20110103021434.000|TR0|have PVC.  Even a simple binder like this 
20110103021434.000|20110103021437.000|TR0|also has it.  And these hard to open 
20110103021437.000|20110103021439.000|TR0|clamshell boxes.  Part of the reason 
20110103021439.000|20110103021442.000|TR0|they're so hard to open is because of PVC.
20110103021442.000|20110103021444.000|TR0|
20110103021444.000|20110103021447.000|TR0|But in order to have all these supplies 
20110103021447.000|20110103021449.000|TR0|that we become so dependent on, we need to 
20110103021449.000|20110103021452.000|TR0|make a lot of PVC, more than 12 billion 
20110103021452.000|20110103021454.000|TR0|pounds a year.  And that, many 
20110103021454.000|20110103021457.000|TR0|environmentalists say, is a problem.

20110103021532.000|20110103021535.000|TR0|Louisiana.     DAVID PRINCE:  Let me get

20110103021548.000|20110103021550.000|TR0|neighboring vinyl chloride plant were 
20110103021550.000|20110103021553.000|TR0|making them sick. But here's what they 
20110103021553.000|20110103021555.000|TR0|didn't know.  There was also pollution 
20110103021555.000|20110103021558.000|TR0|underground.  Thousands of gallons of a

20110103021600.000|20110103021603.000|TR0|dichloride seeping beneath their 
20110103021603.000|20110103021605.000|TR0|neighborhood.

20110103021613.000|20110103021615.000|TR0|tracked down Ray Reynolds in Mayhill, New 
20110103021615.000|20110103021618.000|TR0|Mexico.
20110103021618.000|20110103021620.000|TR0|
20110103021620.000|20110103021623.000|TR0|RAY REYNOLDS, MAYHILL, MEXICO:  I worked 
20110103021623.000|20110103021626.000|TR0|at Condea Vista and I was also chairman of 
20110103021626.000|20110103021628.000|TR0|the union.
20110103021628.000|20110103021631.000|TR0|
20110103021631.000|20110103021633.000|TR0|GUPTA:  The 52-year-old Reynolds suffers 
20110103021633.000|20110103021636.000|TR0|from a rare blood disorder called 
20110103021636.000|20110103021638.000|TR0|demyelinating toxic neuropathy.  That's a 
20110103021638.000|20110103021641.000|TR0|condition he blames on chemical exposure.  
20110103021641.000|20110103021643.000|TR0|Nowadays, he says the mountain air is good 
20110103021643.000|20110103021646.000|TR0|for his health.
20110103021646.000|20110103021648.000|TR0|
20110103021648.000|20110103021651.000|TR0|REYNOLDS:  I have complete kidney failure, 
20110103021651.000|20110103021653.000|TR0|which means without this machine, I would 
20110103021653.000|20110103021656.000|TR0|have maybe two to three weeks to live.  
20110103021656.000|20110103021658.000|TR0|The body -- I would die.
20110103021658.000|20110103021701.000|TR0|
20110103021701.000|20110103021703.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Reynolds travels for dialysis 
20110103021703.000|20110103021706.000|TR0|twice a week.  When he worked at Condea 
20110103021706.000|20110103021709.000|TR0|Vista, Reynolds says the plant water was 
20110103021709.000|20110103021711.000|TR0|contaminated with EDC.  That's ethylene 
20110103021711.000|20110103021714.000|TR0|dichloride.  The chemical was heated to 
20110103021714.000|20110103021716.000|TR0|almost 1,000 degrees, a process called 
20110103021716.000|20110103021719.000|TR0|cracking to produce the vinyl chloride.  
20110103021719.000|20110103021721.000|TR0|EDC is a suspected carcinogen that can 
20110103021721.000|20110103021724.000|TR0|damage the liver, kidneys and nervous 
20110103021724.000|20110103021726.000|TR0|system.
20110103021726.000|20110103021729.000|TR0|
20110103021729.000|20110103021731.000|TR0|We decided to investigate and got a hold 
20110103021731.000|20110103021734.000|TR0|of this internal document.  Take a look at 
20110103021734.000|20110103021736.000|TR0|this.  The EDC problem at the plant was so 
20110103021736.000|20110103021739.000|TR0|bad, this internal memo shows, the 
20110103021739.000|20110103021741.000|TR0|chemical dripped from the ceiling and even 
20110103021741.000|20110103021744.000|TR0|backed up in the toilets.  Because of the 
20110103021744.000|20110103021746.000|TR0|contamination, workers wanted managers to 
20110103021746.000|20110103021749.000|TR0|warn visitors to not even wash their hands 
20110103021749.000|20110103021752.000|TR0|in the water.
20110103021752.000|20110103021754.000|TR0|
20110103021754.000|20110103021757.000|TR0|REYNOLDS:  We threatened to go to court 
20110103021757.000|20110103021759.000|TR0|and bring in our own union testers to test 
20110103021759.000|20110103021802.000|TR0|it.  They wouldn't test the water, you 
20110103021802.000|20110103021804.000|TR0|see.  So as a compromise to us, over every 
20110103021804.000|20110103021807.000|TR0|place that there was a water outlet, they 
20110103021807.000|20110103021809.000|TR0|would put, do not drink.
20110103021809.000|20110103021812.000|TR0|

20110103022346.000|20110103022348.000|TR0|their God-given right to human health.  I 
20110103022348.000|20110103022351.000|TR0|mean, nobody cares.  Nobody cares, as long 
20110103022351.000|20110103022353.000|TR0|as that they are not seemingly directly 
20110103022353.000|20110103022356.000|TR0|affected by what they do.  They don't 
20110103022356.000|20110103022358.000|TR0|worry about it.  They're not concerned 
20110103022358.000|20110103022401.000|TR0|about it.  It's not us.  It is those poor 
20110103022401.000|20110103022403.000|TR0|people in Mossville.  That's the attitude. 
20110103022403.000|20110103022406.000|TR0| That's the attitude you get.

20110103022441.000|20110103022444.000|TR0|
20110103022444.000|20110103022446.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Dorothy Felix knew her community 
20110103022446.000|20110103022449.000|TR0|was suffering.  In fact, not long after an 
20110103022449.000|20110103022451.000|TR0|underground chemical spill turned this 
20110103022451.000|20110103022454.000|TR0|neighborhood into a ghost town, a 
20110103022454.000|20110103022457.000|TR0|University of Texas researcher did a 
20110103022457.000|20110103022459.000|TR0|health survey in Mossville and concluded 
20110103022459.000|20110103022502.000|TR0|the community was very sick.

20110103022504.000|20110103022507.000|TR0|Residents were worrying about dioxin, 
20110103022507.000|20110103022509.000|TR0|often called the most toxic chemical 
20110103022509.000|20110103022512.000|TR0|known.  And they convinced the federal 
20110103022512.000|20110103022514.000|TR0|agency for toxic substances and disease

20110103022925.000|20110103022927.000|TR0|about Subra's detective work in Mossville.
20110103022927.000|20110103022930.000|TR0|
20110103022930.000|20110103022932.000|TR0|But first, dioxins.  Now, you may know 
20110103022932.000|20110103022935.000|TR0|more about them than you think.  Agent 
20110103022935.000|20110103022937.000|TR0|Orange contained dioxin.  American 
20110103022937.000|20110103022940.000|TR0|soldiers in Vietnam used Agent Orange, an 
20110103022940.000|20110103022942.000|TR0|herbicide that got its name because of the 
20110103022942.000|20110103022945.000|TR0|orange stripes on the storage barrels.  
20110103022945.000|20110103022947.000|TR0|Dioxin was an unwanted impurity in the 
20110103022947.000|20110103022950.000|TR0|production process.  The U.S. military 
20110103022950.000|20110103022952.000|TR0|used the defoliant to clear away thick 
20110103022952.000|20110103022955.000|TR0|jungle and reveal Vietcong forces.
20110103022955.000|20110103022958.000|TR0|
20110103022958.000|20110103023000.000|TR0|But Agent Orange had another effect.  In 
20110103023000.000|20110103023003.000|TR0|the decades that followed, soldiers 
20110103023003.000|20110103023005.000|TR0|exposed to Agent Orange were more likely 
20110103023005.000|20110103023008.000|TR0|to develop a range of cancers and possibly 
20110103023008.000|20110103023010.000|TR0|Parkinson's disease, diabetes, 
20110103023010.000|20110103023013.000|TR0|hypertension, and heart disease.  And that 
20110103023013.000|20110103023015.000|TR0|brings us back to Mossville.

20110103024748.000|20110103024750.000|TR0|giant, Hewlett-Packard, Kaiser Permanente, 
20110103024750.000|20110103024753.000|TR0|Office Depot, OfficeMax, Nike, Ford, 
20110103024753.000|20110103024755.000|TR0|Apple, all of them using less polyvinyl 
20110103024755.000|20110103024758.000|TR0|chloride.  That's right.  No PVC in the 
20110103024758.000|20110103024800.000|TR0|new iPad, less manufacturing, and in the 
20110103024800.000|20110103024803.000|TR0|long term, less PVC waste to burn.  All in 
20110103024803.000|20110103024805.000|TR0|all, it could mean less dioxin in the 
20110103024805.000|20110103024808.000|TR0|environment.
20110103024808.000|20110103024810.000|TR0|
20110103024810.000|20110103024813.000|TR0|Back in Mossville, the plants are still 
20110103024813.000|20110103024815.000|TR0|making millions of pounds of vinyl 
20110103024815.000|20110103024818.000|TR0|chloride every year.  Wilma Subra says 
20110103024818.000|20110103024821.000|TR0|chemical industry lobbyists in Louisiana 
20110103024821.000|20110103024823.000|TR0|have talked state lawmakers out of passing 
20110103024823.000|20110103024826.000|TR0|any dioxin standards.     (on camera):  
20110103024826.000|20110103024828.000|TR0|How can this happen?
20110103024828.000|20110103024831.000|TR0|
